class  Lock

Detailed Description

provides registration of SMS sockets to the system and manages all registered SMS sockets

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::Confirm (  ExecutionContext *  context,
SmsPortNo  portno,
BOOLEAN  accept
)  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the confirmation was successfull, accept shall be set to TRUE, if data for the given port shall be cached until SmsSocket is created.

void SmsSocketListener::DumpTables (   )  [static]
 

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::EmptyCache (  SmsPortNo  portno  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the deletion of all cached pdus, related to one port was successfull.

SmsSocket * SmsSocketListener::GetSocket (  SmsPortNo  sms_port_no  )  [static]
 

Returns the socket with the requested port number. A null pointer is returned, when no socket exists or the existing socket was not registered by the calling context.

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::HasPorts (  ExecutionContext *  context = 0  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the given context has any ports. If context = 0 then the method refers to the active context.

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::IsInUse (  SmsPortNo  sms_port_no  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the given port number is already in use in the system.

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::Register (  SmsSocket *  sms_socket  )  [static]
 

Registers a well defined (port_no is valid or not in use) sms socket. If TRUE is returned, then the socket starts listening its port. Method does the same as SmsSocket's Activate

void SmsSocketListener::Startup (   )  [static]
 

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::Subscribe (  ExecutionContext *  context  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the given context was successfully subscribed to get notification if a port sms arrived.

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::Unregister (  SmsSocket *  sms_socket  )  [static]
 

Deactivates a sms socket from listening to its port. Existing data in the socket will be kept available.

BOOLEAN SmsSocketListener::Unsubscribe (  ExecutionContext *  context  )  [static]
 

Returns TRUE, if the given context was successfully unsubscribed.
